Synopsis: 
Sara (Minka Kelly), a talented young designer from Des Moines, arrives in Los Angeles eager to start college and meet the big city. Beautiful, lively and curious Sara naturally attracts the attention of her classmates at a university residence, especially Rebecca (Leighton Meester), his roommate. Rebecca is a wealthy girl from Pasadena who immediately put Sarah under his wing, showing him the best of the city and sharing with her a closet full of designer clothes 

But when Sarah makes friends on campus, including the fun and partying Tracy (Alyson Michalka), Rebecca is isolated and develops a strange way resentful of the social life of her roommate. While Sara's romance with her new boyfriend Steven (Cam Gigandet) is revealed and his mentor, the successful designer Irene (Danneel Harris), arrives in town, she has increasingly less time to spend with Rebecca, who still shows more determined to take Sarah to herself. 

Rebecca unpredictable behavior becomes even more alarming when Sara begins to suspect that Rebecca is sabotaging their relationships with others. When Sarah reluctantly agrees to spend Thanksgiving dinner in the luxurious mansion of the parents of Rebecca, she discovers a secret that convinces him to abandon his university room and move in with Steven. 

As Sara tries to distance himself from his increasingly obsessive ex-roommate, Rebecca suffers a violent and uncontrolled spin, causing the violent confrontation between them is eventually inevitable. 

Production notes: 
The thin line between friendship and obsession divides a dorm in the psychological thriller The Roommate, starring Leighton Meester, Minka Kelly and Cam Gigandet. Christian E.
